message.content:
A 'Veronica polita' is a flowering plant species native to Europe and western Asia. 
It is commonly known as the 'common speedwell' or 'rock speedwell'. 
The plant has small blue-violet flowers that bloom in clusters along the stem. 
The leaves are waxy and smooth with toothed edges, and are dark green in color. 
The stem of the 'Veronica polita' is thin and erect, growing up to 30 cm tall. 
It is often found growing in rocky areas, fields, and on roadsides. 
The plant is used in traditional herbal medicine for its anti-inflammatory and wound-healing properties.
